p: Using DPPH method ( Figure 3a) at different concentrations (0.1–1 mg/mL) of EOs and PEs, radical scavenging activity (RSA) was in the range 1.64–69.95%. There was an increase in RSA as the concentration of EOs and PEs was increased, with PPE and GPE recording the highest (69.95%) and lowest (22.07%) RSA at 1 mg/mL, respectively. For ABTS method ( Figure 3b), a similar trend was observed with RSA in the range 5.33–74.17%, PPE and OO recording the highest (74.95%) and lowest (31.83%) RSA at 1 mg/mL, respectively.
